Syrian commission of inquiry releases report on mass killings in Alawite regions
subhead: The identities of 1,426 victims of the massacres committed in March have been confirmed, and a 'provisional' list of 298 suspects has been drawn up. Yet NGOs fear that the absence of any charges brought against military leaders will lead to a cycle of vengeance and impunity.

headline: Jihadists are intensifying drone attacks in the Sahel
subhead: The Sahelian branch of Al-Qaeda, primarily active in Mali and Burkina Faso, has acquired the capacity to arm low-cost devices. This recent expertise has inflicted heavy losses on national armies.

headline: 'Sorry, Baby,' Eva Victor's fragmented portrait of a young woman grappling with trauma
subhead: The American director's debut feature film embraces its own uniqueness, as does its queer main character, who is in constant search of comfort.

headline: Montmartre residents denounce the Paris neighborhood's 'Disneyfication'
subhead: Rising numbers of tourists and increasingly exasperated residents have made coexistence difficult in Paris' 18th arrondissement, where the effects of overtourism are becoming ever more visible.

How China has relocated its most polluting mines to war-torn Myanmar
subhead: Rare earth elements, essential to various industries, are a growing source of tension between Beijing and the EU, which are set to hold a summit on Thursday, July 24. For decades, their extraction polluted the soil of Jiangxi, a province in southern China. Now, China is exploiting mines in neighboring Myanmar.

headline: French ski coach faces sexual assault complaint involving a minor and new accusations
subhead: Following Le Monde's initial revelations about allegations of sexual harassment of minors against Joël Chenal, a former Olympic ski silver medalist, five young women have come forward with new accounts.

headline: US announces its withdrawal from UNESCO
subhead: The US State Department announced in a statement on Tuesday that the country will leave the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) in December 2026.
